# disableAutomaticLighting

**Type Property**

Disable automatic updates of the scene lighting.

## Declaration

```swift
static let disableAutomaticLighting: ARView.RenderOptions
```

## Discussion

By default, ARKit analyzes the scene lighting in captured camera images and automatically updates lighting in the scene. Add the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/RenderOptions-swift.struct/disableAutomaticLighting] option to the AR view’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/renderOptions-swift.property] to disable the feature.

## Disabling rendering effects

- **disableCameraGrain**: Disable the image noise effect.
- **disableHDR**: Disable the high dynamic range post-processing effect.
- **disableGroundingShadows**: Disable rendering of ambient occlusion and shadows that ground objects in an AR scene.
- **disableMotionBlur**: Disable the motion blur for all virtual content.
- **disableDepthOfField**: Disable the depth of field effect for all virtual content.
- **disableFaceMesh**: Disable generation of the face entity with the default occlusion material.
- **disablePersonOcclusion**: Disable person segmentation.
- **disableAREnvironmentLighting**: Disable lighting from environment probes.
- **disableFaceOcclusions**: Disable automatic face occlusion.
